result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ian S Gourlay

defendant.name: Gourlay, Ian S

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ian S Gourlay in court with attorney Bruce A Fishbain.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State moves to DRI the charge.
BTC: Case DRI.
DNA condition of bond removed (per CC - does not apply to this offense as it occurred prior to April 1, 2015)
Status conference on June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim DL (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ian S Gourlay in court with attorney Bruce A Fishbain.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
